metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26495 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In nbd-server in nbd before 3.24, there is an integer overflow with a resultant heap-based buffer overflow. A value of 0xffffffff in the name length field will cause a zero-sized buffer to be allocated for the name, resulting in a write to a dangling pointer. This issue exists for the NBD_OPT_INFO, NBD_OPT_GO, and NBD_OPT_EXPORT_NAME messages.

criterions.comment: nbd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
